inclusion.criterion: Multiple Myeloma Criteria(International Uniform Response Criteria for Multiple Myeloma)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with responsive disease after any line of induction therapy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients greater than or equal to 18 years of age are eligible. There is upper age limit of 60 years for allogeneic transplants.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have a histologically confirmed diagnosis.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: All patients should have a life expectancy of at least 12 weeks.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have undergone a complete psychosocial evaluation and have been considered capable of compliance.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Meet the following criteria for allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant:
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must have an identified donor match defined as: HLA-A, HLA-B, HLA-C, DRB1 8/8 allele matched sibling, family member, or unrelated donor.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Calculated hematopoietic cell transplantation-specific comorbidity index (HCT-CI) <3
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who do not achieve at least a partial response (PR) by the criteria mentioned above with induction therapy.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patient has a platelet count of <30 x 10^9/L within 14 days before enrollment.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to enrollment or has New York Hospital Association (NYHA) Class III or IV heart failure, uncontrolled angina, severe uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmias, or electrocardiographic evidence of acute ischemia or active conduction system abnormalities.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patient has hypersensitivity to bortezomib, boron or mannitol.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 64yo woman with multiple myeloma, s/p allogeneic transplant with recurrent disease and with systemic amyloidosis (involvement of lungs, tongue, bladder, heart), on hemodialysis for ESRD who represents for malaise, weakness, and generalized body aching x 2 days. She was admitted last week with hypercalcemia and treated with pamidronate 30mg, calcitonin, and dialysis.
